medical_history.chief_complaint: Exacerbation of Avellino corneal dystrophy after LASIK.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Corneal opacities appeared 12 months or more after LASIK. Symptoms progressed with decreased best spectacle-corrected visual acuity as the number and density of opacities increased. One patient experienced severe recurrence within 16 months post-surgery.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Patients had heterozygous Avellino corneal dystrophy and previously noted granular corneal opacities. One patient previously experienced a LASIK procedure without documenting corneal opacities.
medical_history.family_history: Several family members had corneal opacities consistent with Avellino corneal dystrophy. Notably, a father and a sister of one patient had the condition, while other siblings showed no abnormal corneal deposits.
